name: market for packaging, for fertilisers or pesticides | packaging, for fertilisers or pesticides | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15233/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'packaging, for fertilisers or pesticides', in the Global geography.;The reference product refers to the amount of fertiliser or pesticide packed, not the amount of packaging material.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This product is a packaging that is used for fertilisers or pesticides. It is made by high-density polyethylene (HDPE) and it is suitable for liquid and solid pesticides and fertilisers. The product`s end-of-life is also included.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'packaging, for fertilisers or pesticides',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'packaging, for fertilisers or pesticides',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

exchanges.description: The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010. This transport distance is multiplied with the amount of plastic for packaging

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale. This transport distance is multiplied with the amount of plastic for packaging
